official-title.#text:
To end the application of sequestration to the United
		  States Patent and Trademark Office, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Patents and Trademarks Encourage New
			 Technology Jobs Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be available for obligation for the same purpose and in the same manner
			 as if such order had not been issued.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Patent and Trademark Office

text.#text:
Notwithstanding the
			 Presidential order issued on March 1, 2013, under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, on and after
			 the date of the enactment of this Act, the budgetary resources sequestered
			 under such order with respect to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 251A of the Balanced
			 Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985/s:251A

header.#text:
Termination of
			 sequestration in fiscal year 2013 for the Patent and Trademark
			 Office

Exemption from
			 sequestration in fiscal years 2014 through 2021

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding
			 at the end the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 255(g)(1)(A)
			 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act/s:255/ss:g/p:1/sp:A

list-item.#text:
The United States Patent and Trademark Office
				  (13–1006–0–1–376).

shall apply to any sequestration order issued
			 by the
